titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 662) to provide an extension of Federal-aid highway, highway safety, motor carrier safety, transit, and other programs funded out of the Highway Trust Fund pending enactment of a multiyear law reauthorizing such programs.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-20, by Mr. Sessions.

All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived. The amendment printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution, if offered by Representative Mica of Florida or his designee, which shall be in order without intervention of any point of order, shall be considered as read, shall be separately debatable for 10 minutes equally divided and controlled by the proponent and an opponent and shall not be subject to a demand for a division of the question.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 12.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 128.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 256 - 169 (Roll no. 155).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/1/2011--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 662) to provide an extension of Federal-aid highway, highway safety, motor carrier safety, transit, and other programs funded out of the Highway Trust Fund pending enactment of a multiyear law reauthorizing such programs.
